location_machine_xrefs.condition: Very poor. Right ramp didn't register his so no modes, shot multipliers, or super jackpots in multiball or battle royale. Magnet in front of Doc Oc is raised which causes air balls over the opto and into doc oc toy, so no Doc Oc multiball unless you get a lucky roll into the Oc scoop.  Right orbit doesn't register hits so that mode/lock shot is not available. Auto plunger too weak to get ball out of shooter lane. Ball gets stuck on the venom ramp one way gate (needs to be aggressively shaken out, which is fine because there is zero tilt). Leans right. Other than these issues, plays like a dream

Plays as a new pinball machine should, except the action button sticks after every press and it is missing a rubber in the right outlane, which I think is really excessive considering the pricing on this game. The display says $1.00/play but it actually works out to be closer to $3.00/play. For example, if you had 100 'points' on your game card (ten dollars worth), at 26 points per play that would leave you with 22 points remaining on that card after only three games that you can do nothing with! This is a truly scummy way to operate a pinball machine! I wouldnt have been upset if it was $2.00/ play flat because I know these JJP machines are premium quality. But this practice of nickel-and-diming your customer is just offensive and should stop.

Plays really well. It's 13 points on the swipe card for 1/2 credit, so 26 points for 1 game credit, which is somewhere between $1.50 - $2.50 for 1 play depending on how you load your game card. Expensive but kind of worth it because the game is so cool
